title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Friday 3 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: baby taken to hospital after collision involving motorcycle and pram .
driver jailed for causing death of dog walker .
woman treated for smoke inhalation after 'deliberate ' fire .
thieves steal poppy boxes in devon .
could government formula create more homes in the south west ?
bosses at devon hospital launch review after porters cancel planned strikes .
chewing gum 'used to repair ' torpoint ferry .
thousands of truro city fans head to capital .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: hit-and-run driver jailed for dog-walker death
text: a man who killed a dog walker with his car while trying to catch a train has been found guilty of causing death by dangerous driving .
jonathan kane , 52 , of flood street chelsea , failed to stop after striking catherine bailey with his land rover near st minver , cornwall , in july last year .
kane , ( in the middle below ) who has a second home near polzeath , said he `` simply did n't see '' mrs bailey
his victim 's body was found later in a ditch later by her husband .
the impact had severed her spine and broken 14 ribs .
he was jailed for two years and disqualified from driving for five years .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: public health england to invest in helping smokers
text: more than 55,000 smokers are ending up in hospital across the south west every year , according to latest figures from public health england .
it says it 's advised frontline healthcare staff to work even harder to cut these numbers by giving patients advice or stop smoking support .
from 2018 , additional funding will be available to acute nhs providers to help achieve targets for delivery of quit advice .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: truro city - the fa cup side on the brink of homelessness
text: whatever happens at charlton athletic on sunday , truro city have already made history , with the white tigers being the first club from cornwall to reach the first round of the fa cup for almost 50 years .

but almost five years ago the club almost folded after financial problems , leading city to sell their treyew road ground to developers for a retail park - with work due to start at the end of this season .
city will have to share a ground , either with a cornish side if they stay in national league south , or a club further afield if they gain promotion .

they are due to move in to the planned new stadium for cornwall , but with work yet to start , chairman peter masters told bbc sport that construction must begin soon in order for the club to survive :

`` phillip perryman ( vice chairman ) and myself are not quitters , we 're investing in the club and we can see a sustainable future at some point , and that sustainable future involves us being in that stadium for cornwall and we need to be there within the next 24 months , '' masters told bbc sport .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: public to have their say on fire service plans
text: people are being asked for their views on a new plan by devon and somerset fire and rescue service which sets out how they 'll protect the public in the future .
the draft document highlights how its resources will be used and the ways the service can evolve to meet the changing needs of the community .
the service says only about a quarter of incidents they attend are fires .
the public consultation will run until 31 december .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: saturday 's weather : sunny spells and showers
text: cloud and rain will clear to the east on saturday morning leaving a mixture of sunny spells and some heavy and blustery showers .
it will feel cold in the northwesterly wind .
maximum temperature : 12c ( 54f )
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: exmouth deaf academy plans approved
text: plans to create a 'world class ' academy in exmouth providing education and care services to deaf children , young people , and their families have been approved .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: devon teams vow to end use of pyrotechnics
text: exeter city , plymouth argyle and torquay united have joined their fellow english football league members in a pledge to help end the use of dangerous pyrotechnics within efl football grounds .
on the eve of bonfire night , the chairman 's charter reflects concerns over the number of flares , fireworks and even smoke bombs entering football grounds .
in 2013 , a 15-year-old was hospitalised for lung damage caused by a smoke bomb , while children as young as eight have been used as `` mules '' to smuggle pyrotechnics into stadiums .

taking a hard angle , efl chief executive shaun harvey said : taking pyrotechnics into our grounds is a criminal offence and , where there is evidence that the law has been broken , the police will always seek to impose a football banning order as an appropriate measure . ''
| clubs united as @ twitterid tackles football 's pyrotechnic problem full story # ecfc
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingdriver jailed for death of dog walker
text: a man has been given a two-year jail sentence for causing death by dangerous driving .
jonathan kane ( in the middle below ) was found guilty at truro crown court .
the 52-year-old , of flood street , chelsea , killed kate bailey in st minver , north cornwall .
her body was found in the early hours of 19 july 2016 .
kane has also been disqualified from driving for five years .

documents.title: devon business school in new sport study
text: the university of exeter business school has found that football clubs that keep changing their manager could be putting the staff vital for achieving top results at risk .
it found frequent changes at the top puts pressure on sports scientists - who are increasingly key to athletes achieving results .
some of the clubs in the study had up to five managers in as many years .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: local sports club awarded grant
text: a water sports club near plymouth has started building a new boat shed to store equipment after receiving a grant .
the weir quay community watersports hub club in bere alston , has been awarded £ 20,000 from the national grid 's community grant programme .
the fund was set up for community organisations and charities in areas where work is impacting on local people .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon bridge damaged by teenagers in crash
text: an ancient bridge near killerton has been left damaged by teenagers who crashed into it .
the incident took place on ellerhayes bridge at about 04:00 gmt on thursday morning .
two 18-year-old men and one 19-year-old man are currently in police custody after being arrested on sus of aggravated vehicle taking and dangerous driving .
it 's believed they stole a car from foxhayes road in exeter at 21:00 gmt on thursday night .
police are asking anyone with information to contact them on 101 .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: cornish boy , 9 , writes to gary barlow after missing out on gig tickets
text: a nine-year-old boy from redruth has written to the singer , gary barlow , after missing out on tickets to see the take that star at the eden project .

zachary simmons was looking forward to seeing him perform but when his mum samantha tried to buy two tickets as a christmas present , none of them were available on the official eden sessions website .
samantha has shared a copy of the letter on social media in the hope it will be spotted by mr barlow himself .
eden sessions organisers say there was a `` massive demand '' for tickets which meant `` that even people high up in the queue to enter the ticket buying process were n't successful . ''
they also said they are aware that tickets are already appearing on re-seller sites , adding they `` do not sell or provide tickets directly to any of these sites '' .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: damaged bridge : calls to find drivers
text: motorists are being asked to identify the culprits whose driving continues to damage the historic bickleigh bridge .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: tisdale not taking any fa cup chances
text: exeter city manager paul tisdale says he will not play a weakened team when his side host heybridge swifts in sunday 's fa cup first round tie .
eighth-tier heybridge are the lowest-ranked side left in the competition having played seven matches to make it through the first round .

city have craig woodman and pierce sweeney available after missing last week 's 1-1 draw at mansfield while lee holmes , who came off the bench to score the equaliser , is getting closer to being fit enough to start .
`` it 's the first round of the fa cup and we want to win it , '' tisdale told bbc sport .
`` i 'll make a selection based on providing the best performance , but not about giving players games . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: five police officers 'bitten by suspect '
text: five police officers were taken to hospital in the early hours of friday morning after being bitten by a suspect they were trying to detain in plymouth , devon and cornwall police has said .
they each suffered varying degrees of bites , scratches and cuts after being called to the disturbance on hoegate street .
the officers have now all returned to duty .
a 55-year-old man has been arrested on sus of assault .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: money invested to 'future-proof ' exeter airport
text: exeter airport has announced a £ 6m investment in infrastructure to help future-proof it over the next 20 years .
the airport 's runway will be resurfaced and all runway lighting will be replaced with energy-efficient leds .
the work will be carried out at night during weekends until march 2018 to avoid disruption to passengers .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: have you ever seen a lorry as long as this ?
text: this very long vehicle was spotted today on the a39 in cornwall on its way to falmouth from truro .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: thieves steal poppy boxes in devon
text: two poppy charity collection boxes have been stolen in plymouth .
the thefts took place in two shops in the plymstock area of the city .

carole arnold , from the royal british legion in devon , says unfortunately it happens every year , but it 's unusual for it to happen so early on , with thieves normally waiting until the tins are full .
the charity is working with devon and cornwall police to try and stop it from happening .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: teignbridge fills empty homes
text: the number of homes lying empty in teignbridge is at an all-time low , it has emerged .
teignbridge district council has cut the number of vacant properties with figures showing numbers have dropped by more than half from 735 empty homes in 2008 to 361 in 2017 so far .
teignbridge is the only devon authority to have reduced the amount left unoccupied every year since 2008 .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: hit-and-run death jury considers verdict
text: the jury trying a man accused of mowing down and killing a dog walker in cornwall has been sent out to consider its verdict at truro crown court .
catherine bailey was found dead in a ditch near st minver in july 2016 , after being struck by a land rover driven by jonathan kane .

the 52-year-old , of flood street , chelsea , who has a second home near polzeath , denies causing death by dangerous driving , but has admitted lesser charges of causing death by careless driving , causing death by driving whilst unlicensed or uninsured , and one count of dangerous driving .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: old postal routes across exmoor investigated as part of new project
text: as part of their new archive project , staff and volunteers at the exmoor society are investigating the old postal routes across exmoor .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: devon travel : broken-down vehicle
text: devon travel : broken-down vehicle
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: full steam ahead for devon railway gala
text: people in devon will get the chance to view a huge array of diesel engines this weekend as part of a gala at south devon railway .
it 's home to a fleet of `` first generation '' diesels that were built during the 1950s and 1960s to replace steam traction in the post dr beeching era .
visitors will also have an opportunity to join some of the volunteers at the railway and drive one of the locomotives .
author: Sophie Pierce
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: baby taken to hospital after collision involving motorcycle and pram
text: police have been called to a collision in falmouth involving a motorcycle and a pram with a baby in it .
the infant , along with its mother and another child who sustained minor cuts and bruises , was taken to hospital following the incident on dracaena avenue on friday morning .
it 's believed the motorcyclist was riding a kawasaki motorcycle .
inquiries into the incident are under way , say devon and cornwall police .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: fully fit squad for truro 's big day
text: truro city manager lee hodges has no injury concerns as his side prepare for the biggest game in the club 's history .
city travel to league one side charlton athletic in their first-ever appearance in the first round of the fa cup .
the white tigers are the first cornish side to reach the first round of the fa cup in 48 years .
`` we 've made sure we 've done everything right in our power to make sure we go there and compete , '' hodges told bbc radio cornwall .
`` i 'm sure all the boys who are turning up will be really looking forward to playing in an unbelievable stadium , an unbelievable pitch in front of thousands of fans . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: rail strikes planned next week
text: a two-day strike on south western railway ( swr ) will go ahead next week after talks broke down on thursday .
the rmt union wants a guarantee that a guard will be on every train .
the company has promised to do this but the union says this is a loophole which could allow some services to run without a second crew member after new trains are delivered in two years ' time .
swr says it will run more than 60 % of services during planned strikes next month .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: weather update : cloudy afternoon with some drizzle
text: it will be a cloudy afternoon with some mist , although there will be a little brightness .
cloud will thicken later on with the odd spot of drizzle .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: baby murder trial : jury consider verdict for third day
text: a jury has started a third day of deliberations in the trial of a part-time fitness instructor accused of murdering his adoptive 18-month-old daughter .
matthew scully-hicks , 31 , is accused of inflicting fatal injuries on elsie scully-hicks while he was looking after her at his home in llandaff , cardiff , on 25 may 2016 .
the toddler collapsed at around 18:20 and scully-hicks , of delabole , cornwall , dialled 999 to say she was not moving or breathing .
elsie was rushed to university hospital of wales where she died in the early hours of 29 may .
scully-hicks and his husband , craig scully-hicks , 36 , had formally adopted elsie two weeks earlier .
prosecutors claim scully-hicks gripped elsie around her ribs , shook her and struck her head - causing fatal injuries .
the defendant , who denies murder , insists he did not harm elsie and found her unresponsive after changing her for bed .
mrs justice nicola davies sent the jury of nine men and three women at cardiff crown court out to consider their verdicts just after 15:00 on wednesday .
the jury can return one of three verdicts - guilty of murder , guilty of manslaughter , or not guilty .
author: Press Association

documents.title: missing man found 'safe and well '
text: a missing man from st austell has been found `` safe and well '' , police have said .
jessie mclean was found on friday morning , officers added .

documents.title: bonfire night flare warning
text: the maritime and coastguard agency ( mca ) is warning people not to use flares instead of fireworks , ahead of bonfire night .
we do n't want to spoil the fun of # bonfirenight but please do n't be tempted to use flares instead of fireworks .
we do n't want to put our crews ' lives in danger by responding to what they think might be a genuine cry for help .
# 999coastguard please share © @ p b o
@ twitterid are you paying attention to this mr allen ! ! ?
retweeted and shared to facebook .
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 2nd for nov 3 . )
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: new technologies from plymouth inventor a 'real achievement '
text: a plymouth inventor has been praised for securing two patents from the us for his new technologies .
dr zaki ahmed - from plymouth university - has come up with two designs to make homes and workplaces more energy efficient .
one reduces the power consumed by led lights and the other boosts the electricity that can be generated by solar panels .

chris jenkins from plymouth science park said , `` given the fact that plymouth as a city generates an incredibly low level of patent applications - ty one or two a year - for dr zaki to come up with two and to get them granted in the us , is a real achievement . ''
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: devon travel : lane closed on m5
text: on the m5 northbound between exeter and cullompton , one lane is closed and there 's slow traffic due to an accident .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: cornwall warning that brexit could leave it without farm and tourism staff
text: some of cornwall 's largest food growers have warned that broccoli , cauliflowers and flowers will rot in fields if there is no-one to harvest their crops after brexit .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: weather update : a cloudy start with some sunshine
text: it will be a cloudy start with any mist or fog patches clearing through the morning .
a mainly cloudy day with some brightness plus the odd spot of sunshine at times .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: matthews set for argyle fa cup tie
text: plymouth argyle will be able to select on-loan goalkeeper remi matthews in their fa cup first round tie with grimsby .
the 23-year-old is on an emergency loan from norwich city with argyle 's three senior stoppers all injured .
the pilgrims will also be without oscar threlkeld , ryan taylor and jamie ness , although the latter is returning to training .
the pilgrims will hope to repeat last year 's cup run when they drew liverpool in the third round and took them back to home park for a replay after a goalless draw at anfield .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: bosses at devon hospital launch review after porters cancel planned strikes
text: porters at the royal devon & exeter hospital will no longer be going on strike this weekend - after reaching an agreement with management over their working hours .
hospital bosses and the union , unison , reached what they 're calling an `` interim deal '' over the proposed introduction of 12-hour shifts .
the hospital trust says it has launched a full review of all the hospital 's support workers , including porters .
the strike was due to begin on friday night .
porters at the hospital walked out earlier this month over plans to lengthen their shifts from eight hours to 12 hours .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: weather update : fog warning
text: there 's a yellow weather warning of fog for parts of east devon this morning .
the met office says it will slowly clear but hazardous driving conditions and slower journey times can be expected .
also delays to bus and train services as well as flights are possible .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cup has key role in exeter success
text: the anglo-welsh cup has played a key role in exeter 's rise to becoming premiership champions , says coach ricky pellow .
the chiefs have reached the last three finals , winning the title in 2014 .
`` it 's a massive part of the jigsaw puzzle for us as a club , '' said pellow .
`` we won the premiership not with 23 players , but won it on the 52-man squad and this competition allows us to give those guys game time and the chance to be in front of myself and the coaches . ''
exeter begin their campaign at home to northampton , with both sides unbeaten at the top of their respective 'a ' league pools .
pellow says it is a platform in the past has seen some of exeter 's current england players use to propel themselves into the main squad .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: police appeal for missing cornwall man
text: police are trying to find a man who has gone missing from st austell .
jessie mclean , who has links to camborne and penzance , was last seen at about 18:00 on thursday .
he is described as a white man , 6ft 2in ( 1.87m ) tall , of slim build and wearing a grey/blue jumper .
anyone who information is asked to contact police .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon travel update : fallen tree blocks road
text: devon travel update : fallen tree blocks road
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: giant cornish seahorse cake set to wow visitors
text: a cornish company has created a huge cake in the shape of a seahorse which will go on display at a national baking show .
bakers , based in penzance , have made the cake in a bid to raise money for the marine conservation society ( mcs ) .
the cake , which stands at 6ft ( 1.8m ) , will be cut up on the final day of the cake international show in birmingham and sold to visitors .
a spokesman from the mcs said : `` not many people realise that seahorses inhabit our waters in the uk , mainly around the south coast .
but their habitat is under threat - here it 's the loss of their seagrass habitat whilst abroad they are taken from the wild as part of the horrendous curio trade . ''
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: chewing gum 'used to repair ' torpoint ferry
text: engineers on the torpoint ferry have used chewing gum to plug a leak , the company has confirmed .
the ferry had been forced to run a reduced service on friday morning due to a `` technical issue '' .
the service has now been restored to three ferries .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: woman treated for smoke inhalation after 'deliberate ' fire
text: a 70-year-old woman has been treated by paramedics after a fire at a home in starcross .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said the blaze was started deliberately .
crews from dawlish , exeter and teignmouth were called at 06:00 by the woman .
she was treated for smoke inhalation .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: charity saves eight dartmoor foals but says it 's a 'losing battle '
text: a cornish animal charity has come to the rescue of eight young dartmoor foals .
the bolenowe animal sanctuary , based on the lizard peninsula , stepped in to save the ponies after they were parted from their mums and removed from the moor .
hundreds of foals are taken off in the drift which is when ponies are rounded up to get a health check .
the sick and old as well as those being sold are separated and the rest are returned to the moor .
the sanctuary says there is such a large volume of foals , it 's a `` losing battle '' and not all of them can be saved .
the ones that ca n't find homes are often shot .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: tributes to former plymouth rugby president
text: tributes have been paid to a former president of plymouth albion rugby club who has died at the age of 76 .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: plymouth inventor receives us patent for new technologies
text: an inventor from plymouth university has come up with two new technologies to make homes and workplaces significantly more energy efficient .
one reduces the power consumed by led lights and the other boosts the electricity that can be generated by solar panels .
unusually , both have just received us patents - a feather in the cap for the university and its science park .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: devon travel : burst water main and slow traffic
text: devon travel : burst water main and slow traffic
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: two ferry service after technical issue
text: a technical issue has reduced the torpoint ferry to a two ferry service , causing some delays .
ferry : two ferry service while we investigate a technical issue .
minor delays only at present we will update when we have more details .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: thousands of truro city fans head to capital
text: truro city are preparing to make history this weekend as the first cornish football team to play in the first round of the fa cup for almost half a century .
a win over hampton and richmond in the last round set up the illustrious tie against charlton athletic from league one .
thousands of cornish football supporters are expected to make the trip to london to see if the team of part timers can be the side that makes the headlines this weekend .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: could government formula create more homes in the south west ?
text: places where people get paid more money can expect to see more homes being built in the future if a new government formula is adopted across the south west .
in the south hams , the number of homes built every year could rise from just under 200 to more than 350 if the new proposal from the department for communities and local government is enacted .
it 's consulting about the idea which would see the number of houses needed in torbay reduced by about a half .
those in the housing industry say the formula is needed .
author: John Henderson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for friday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online
